intro: Onobrychis semnanensis, commonly known as the Semnan burr vetch, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in racemes, contributing to its ornamental value. Onobrychis semnanensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing forage for livestock and supporting biodiversity.
